meanings.definition: To prance or caper around playfully
meanings.sent1: The children cavorted in the park, laughing and jumping.
meanings.sent2: The puppies cavorted in the yard, chasing each other joyfully.
meanings.sent3: The kittens cavorted with a ball of yarn, creating a cute mess.
meanings.sent4: The leaves cavorted in the wind, dancing across the street.
meanings.sent5: The dolphins cavorted in the waves, showing off their acrobatic skills.

meanings.definition: To engage in lively or boisterous behavior
meanings.sent1: During the party, the guests cavorted on the dance floor.
meanings.sent2: The friends cavorted at the beach, enjoying the sunny day.
meanings.sent3: The monkeys cavorted in the trees, swinging from branch to branch.
meanings.sent4: The flames cavorted in the fireplace, crackling and flickering.
meanings.sent5: The athletes cavorted on the field, celebrating their victory.

meanings.definition: To frolic or romp in a carefree manner
meanings.sent1: The puppies cavorted in the meadow, rolling in the grass.
meanings.sent2: The children cavorted in the playground, having a great time.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels cavorted in the garden, chasing each other around.
meanings.sent4: The waves cavorted on the shore, splashing and swirling.
meanings.sent5: The birds cavorted in the sky, soaring and diving gracefully.
